   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(standard_error_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0,suite/0]).
   26: -export([badarg/1,getopts/1,output/1,logging/1]).
   27: 
   28: suite() ->
   29:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   30: 
   31: all() ->
   32:     [badarg,getopts,output,logging].
   33: 
   34: badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   35:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch io:put_chars(standard_error, [oops])),
   36:     true = erlang:is_process_alive(whereis(standard_error)),
   37:     ok.
   38: 
   39: %% Check that standard_out and standard_error have the same encoding
   40: getopts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   41:     Encoding = proplists:get_value(encoding, io:getopts(user)),
   42:     Encoding = proplists:get_value(encoding, io:getopts(standard_error)),
   43:     ok.
   44: 
   45: %% Test that writing a lot of output to standard_error does not cause the
   46: %% processes handling it to terminate like this:
   47: %%
   48: %%    =ERROR REPORT==== 9-Aug-2015::23:19:23 ===
   49: %%    ** Generic server standard_error_sup terminating
   50: %%    ** Last message in was {'EXIT',<0.28.0>,eagain}
   51: %%    ** When Server state == {state,standard_error,undefined,<0.28.0>,
   52: %%                                   {local,standard_error_sup}}
   53: %%    ** Reason for termination ==
   54: %%    ** eagain
   55: %%
   56: %% This problem, observed with Erlang 18.0.2, was fixed in fd_driver by
   57: %% properly handling EAGAIN if it arises on file descriptor writes.
   58: %%
   59: output(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   60:     Ref = monitor(process, standard_error_sup),
   61:     Chars = [ [["1234567890" || _ <- lists:seq(1,10)], $\s,
   62:                integer_to_list(L), $\r, $\n] || L <- lists:seq(1, 100) ],
   63:     ok = io:put_chars(standard_error, Chars),
   64:     receive
   65:         {'DOWN', Ref, process, _, _} ->
   66:             error(standard_error_noproc)
   67:     after
   68:         500 ->
   69:             ok
   70:     end.
   71: 
   72: logging(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   73: 
   74:     #{ level := Level } = logger:get_primary_config(),
   75: 
   76:     try
   77:         Parent = self(),
   78: 
   79:         Device = spawn(fun F() ->
   80:                                receive
   81:                                    {io_request, From, ReplyAs, M} ->
   82:                                        From ! {io_reply, ReplyAs, ok},
   83:                                        Parent ! M,
   84:                                        F()
   85:                                end
   86:                        end),
   87: 
   88:         logger:add_handler(stderr, logger_std_h, #{ filter_default => stop,
   89:                                                     config => #{ type => {device, Device} } } ),
   90: 
   91:         ok = io:setopts(standard_error, [{log, all}]),
   92: 
   93:         logger:set_primary_config(level, all),
   94: 
   95:         io:put_chars(standard_error, "hello"),
   96: 
   97:         receive
   98:             M1 -> ct:fail({unexpected, M1})
   99:         after 5000 -> ok
  100:         end,
  101: 
  102:         logger:add_handler_filter(stderr,domain,{fun logger_filters:domain/2, {log, sub, [otp, kernel, io, output]}}),
  103: 
  104:         io:put_chars(standard_error, "world"),
  105: 
  106:         receive
  107:             {put_chars,unicode, Msg} ->
  108:                 true = string:find(Msg, "world") =/= nomatch;
  109:             M2 ->
  110:                 ct:fail({unexpected, M2})
  111:         after 5000 -> ct:fail(timeout)
  112:         end
  113: 
  114:     after
  115:         logger:set_primary_config(level, Level),
  116:         logger:remove_handler(stderr),
  117:         io:setopts(standard_error, [{log, false}])
  118:     end.
